chapter.title: Design Overview
chapter.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; has modular design. Each protocol has its own separate module. This module depends only on its provider - that is for instance SCCP depends only from MTP and TCAP depends on SCCP. This makes it easy to customize whole &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION;. Specific protocol module has list of all dependencies along with information on general design. Please refer to module description for more information.

listitem.para: Linkset is logical shortcut. This term hides MTP layer, ie. it abstracts whether hardware MTP is used , M3UA or &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; one.
Service is element which is used to manage LinkSets and protocols like SCCP.
For full explanation please refer to .

Shell is tool which allows to manage different aspects of &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; in interactive manner. It connects to different instances of &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; which manage Linksets and SCCP routing. For detailed information please refer to:
. Usually Shell will be invoked from remote machine(remote to Linksets and application protocols).
Application term encapsulates not only application level protocols(such as SCCP or ISUP ) but also entities which make use of them(like SLEE RA & Service )

Service persists linksets information and manages their lifecycle, ie. it creates, activates them(also after restart).
